context: Comcast has also earned a reputation for being <a0_0>anti-union<a0_0/>. According to <a4_0>one of the company's training manuals<a4_0/>, "Comcast does not feel <b7_0>union representation<b7_0/> is in the best interest of its employees, customers, or shareholders". A dispute in 2004 with <b9_0>CWA<b9_0/>, a labor union that represented many employees at Comcast's offices in <a1_0><b5_0>Beaverton, Oregon<b5_0/><a1_0/>, led to allegations of management intimidating workers, requiring them to <a2_0>attend <b8_0>anti-union meetings<b8_0/><a2_0/> and unwarranted disciplinary action for union members. In 2011, Comcast received criticism from <a3_0><b6_0>Writers Guild of America<b6_0/><a3_0/> for its policies in regards to unions.
